game.player_board 

  1from game.board import Board
  2from game.enums import Cell, Result, Direction, MoveType, WinReason
  3import numpy as np
  4from enum import IntEnum, auto
  5from typing import Tuple, List
  6
  7
  8class PlayerBoard:
  9    """
 10    A wrapper around the Board class to be able to call board and
 11    chicken functions from the player's perspective. 
 12    
 13    There are two ways to call functions in your opponent's perspective. 
 14    1. You may call functions with the "enemy" parameter as True.  
 15    2. You may instead reverse the perspective of the board
 16    through apply_move, forecast, or reverse_perspective. This will allow you to
 17    call functions from your opponents perspective. 
 18
 19    The playerboard you are passed will have the trapdoors unset, meaning you
 20    will have to keep track of the trapdoors yourself and set them at the beginning
 21    of each turn.  Trapdoor data is held
 22    by the game runner, so you will have to find and set the trapdoors yourself via set_trapdoor.
 23    Before then, any functions trying to get trapdoor data will not return anything valuable.
 24
 25    Any coordinates should be given to the player_board functions in the form of x, y.
 26    Game objects are displayed, indexed, and stored on the 
 27    board arrays as arr[y, x] for geometrical accuracy. Any functions that return
 28    mask arrays of the board that should be indexed by [y, x].
 29
 30    Check_validity/check_ok is on by default for most functions, but slows
 31    down execution. If a player is confident their actions are valid,
 32    they can directly apply turns and moves with check_validity as false.
 33
 34    Be wary that invalid actions/turns/function calls could lead to functions throwing
 35    errors, so make sure to handle them with a try/except in case so that
 36    your program doesn't crash. If an apply function throws an error,
 37    it is not guarenteed that the board state will be valid or that the state
 38    will be the same as when the function started.
 39    """
 40    def __init__(self, is_player_a:bool, game_board: Board):
 41        """
 42        Parameters:  
 43            is_player_a (bool): If True, the player is player A; if False, the player is player B.
 44            game_board (Board): The game board object that holds the state of the current match.
 45        """
 46        
 47        self.game_board = game_board
 48        self.is_player_a = is_player_a
 49
 50        self.chicken_player = game_board.chicken_a if is_player_a else game_board.chicken_b
 51        self.chicken_enemy = game_board.chicken_b if is_player_a else game_board.chicken_a
 52
 53        self.player_cells_blocked = game_board.cells_blocked_a if is_player_a else game_board.cells_blocked_b
 54        self.enemy_cells_blocked = game_board.cells_blocked_b if is_player_a else game_board.cells_blocked_a
 55
 56        self.player_egg_list = game_board.egg_list_a if is_player_a else game_board.egg_list_b
 57        self.enemy_egg_list = game_board.egg_list_b if is_player_a else game_board.egg_list_a
 58
 59        self.player_turd_list = game_board.turd_list_a if is_player_a else game_board.egg_list_b
 60        self.enemy_turd_list = game_board.turd_list_b if is_player_a else game_board.turd_list_a
 61
 62    ######################################################
 63    # BOARD STATE READING FUNCTIONS
 64    def get_dim_board(self) -> int:
 65        """
 66        Returns one dimension of the board.
 67
 68        Returns:  
 69            (int): Dimension of the board.
 70        """
 71        return self.game_board.game_map.MAP_SIZE
 72    
 73    def get_turn_count(self) -> int:
 74        """
 75        Returns the total number of turns that have been played.
 76
 77        Returns:
 78            (int): Number of turns played
 79        """
 80        return self.game_board.turn_count
 81
 82    
 83    def is_game_over(self) -> bool:
 84        """
 85        Checks if the game is over by determining if a winner
 86        has been set. Win conditions are checked by the game
 87        at the end of every turn.
 88
 89        Returns:  
 90            bool: True if the game is over, False otherwise.
 91        """
 92        return self.game_board.is_game_over()
 93    
 94    def get_egg_list(self, enemy:bool = False) -> List[Tuple[int, int]]:
 95        """
 96        Returns a copy of the list of laid eggs positions 
 97        for the player or enemy.
 98
 99        Parameters:
100            enemy (bool, optional): If True, returns enemy's egg list; if False, returns player's egg list.
101
102        Returns:
103            (List[Tuple[int, int]]): A copy of the egg position list.
104        """
105        if enemy:
106            return self.enemy_egg_list[:]
107        return self.player_egg_list[:]
108    
109    def get_turd_list(self, enemy:bool = False) -> List[Tuple[int, int]]:
110        """
111        Returns a copy of the list of placed turd positions 
112        for the player or enemy.
113
114        Parameters:
115            enemy (bool, optional): If True, returns enemy's turd list; if False, returns player's turd list.
116
117        Returns:
118            (List[Tuple[int, int]]): A copy of the turd position list.
119        """
120        if(enemy):
121            return self.enemy_turd_list[:]
122        return self.player_turd_list[:]
123
124    def get_cells_blocked(self, enemy:bool = False) -> np.ndarray:
125        """
126        Returns a copy of the blocked cells array for the player or enemy.
127        
128        Parameters:
129            enemy (bool, optional): If True, returns enemy's blocked cells; if False, returns player's blocked cells.
130
131        Returns:
132            (np.ndarray): A 2D array where blocked cells have values > 0, indexed by [y, x].
133        """
134        if(enemy):
135            return np.array(self.enemy_cells_blocked)
136        return np.array(self.player_cells_blocked)
137    
138    def get_cells_eggsturds(self) -> np.ndarray:
139        """
140        Returns a mask of the board with the cells containing
141        eggs and turds marked with enums.
142
143        Returns:
144            (np.ndarray): A 2D array indicating egg and turd locations, indexed by [y, x].
145        """
146        return np.array(self.game_board.cells_eggsturds)
147    
148    def cell_has_eggsturds(self, x: int, y: int) -> Cell:
149        """
150        Checks if a specific cell contains an egg or turd.
151
152        Parameters:
153            x (int): The x-coordinate of the cell.
154            y (int): The y-coordinate of the cell.
155
156        Returns:
157            (Cell): The Cell enum value indicating what is at that location.
158        """
159        return Cell(self.game_board.cells_eggsturds[y][x])
160    
161    def is_cell_blocked(self, x, y, enemy:bool = False) -> bool:
162        """
163        Checks if a specific cell is blocked for the player or enemy.
164
165        Parameters:
166            x (int): The x-coordinate of the cell.
167            y (int): The y-coordinate of the cell.
168            enemy (bool, optional): If True, checks enemy's blocked cells; if False, checks player's blocked cells.
169
170        Returns:
171            (bool): True if the cell is blocked, False otherwise.
172        """
173        if(enemy):
174            return self.enemy_cells_blocked[y,x] > 0
175        return self.player_cells_blocked[y,x] > 0
176    
177    def get_trapdoors(self) -> List[Tuple[int, int]]:
178        """
179        Returns a copy of the trapdoor list.
180
181        Returns:
182            (List[Tuple[int, int]]): Array containing trapdoor positions.
183        """
184        return self.game_board.trapdoors[:]
185
186    def has_trapdoor(self, x:int , y:int) -> bool:
187        """
188        Checks if a specific cell has a trapdoor.
189
190        Parameters:
191            x (int): The x-coordinate of the cell.
192            y (int): The y-coordinate of the cell.
193
194        Returns:
195            (bool): True if there is a trapdoor at that location, False otherwise.
196        """
197        return self.game_board.cells_trapdoors[y,x] > 0
198    
199    def get_num_trapdoors_set(self)-> int:
200        """
201        Returns the number of trapdoors that have been set.
202
203        Returns:
204            (int): Number of trapdoors currently marked.
205        """
206        return self.game_board.trapdoors_marked
207
208    def get_turns_left(self, enemy: bool=False) -> int:
209        """
210        Returns the number of turns remaining for the player or enemy.
211
212        Parameters:
213            enemy (bool, optional): If True, returns enemy's turns left; if False, returns player's turns left.
214
215        Returns:
216            (int): Number of turns remaining.
217        """
218        if(self.is_player_a != enemy):
219            return self.game_board.turns_left_a
220        return self.game_board.turns_left_b
221    
222    def get_am_player_a(self, enemy: bool = False) -> bool:
223        """
224        Checks if the current perspective is player A.
225
226        Parameters:
227            enemy (bool, optional): If True, checks if enemy is player A; if False, checks if player is player A.
228
229        Returns:
230            (bool): True if the specified player is player A, False otherwise.
231        """
232        return self.is_player_a != enemy
233
234    def has_moves_left(self, enemy:bool = False) -> bool:
235        """
236        Checks if the player or enemy has moves remaining.
237
238        Parameters:
239            enemy (bool, optional): If True, checks enemy's moves; if False, checks player's moves.
240
241        Returns:
242            (bool): True if there are moves left, False otherwise.
243        """
244        return self.game_board.has_moves_left(self.is_player_a != enemy)
245
246    def is_valid_cell(self, x:int, y:int) -> bool:
247        """
248        Checks if the given coordinates are within the valid board boundaries.
249
250        Parameters:
251            x (int): The x-coordinate to check.
252            y (int): The y-coordinate to check.
253
254        Returns:
255            (bool): True if the cell is valid, False otherwise.
256        """
257        return self.game_board.is_valid_cell(x, y)
258
259    def is_valid_move(self, dir:Direction | int, move_type:MoveType | int, enemy:bool = False) -> bool:
260        """
261        Checks if a move is valid for the player or enemy.
262
263        Parameters:
264            dir (Direction or int): The direction of the move.
265            move_type (MoveType or int): The type of move (walk, run, fly).
266            enemy (bool, optional): If True, checks validity for enemy; if False, checks for player.
267
268        Returns:
269            (bool): True if the move is valid, False otherwise.
270        """
271        return self.game_board.is_valid_move(dir, move_type, self.is_player_a != enemy)
272    
273    def can_lay_egg(self, enemy:bool=False) -> bool:
274        """
275        Checks if the player or enemy can lay an egg at their current location.
276
277        Parameters:
278            enemy (bool, optional): If True, checks for enemy; if False, checks for player.
279
280        Returns:
281            (bool): True if an egg can be laid, False otherwise.
282        """
283        return self.game_board.can_lay_egg(self.is_player_a != enemy)
284    
285    def can_lay_egg_at_loc(self, x:int, y:int, enemy:bool=False) -> bool:
286        """
287        Checks if the player or enemy can lay an egg at a specific location.
288
289        Parameters:
290            x (int): The x-coordinate of the location.
291            y (int): The y-coordinate of the location.
292            enemy (bool, optional): If True, checks for enemy; if False, checks for player.
293
294        Returns:
295            (bool): True if an egg can be laid at that location, False otherwise.
296        """
297        return self.game_board.can_lay_egg_at_loc(x, y, self.is_player_a != enemy)
298    
299    def can_lay_turd(self, enemy:bool = False) -> bool:
300        """
301        Checks if the player or enemy can lay a turd at their current location.
302
303        Parameters:
304            enemy (bool, optional): If True, checks for enemy; if False, checks for player.
305
306        Returns:
307            (bool): True if a turd can be laid, False otherwise.
308        """
309        return self.game_board.can_lay_turd(self.is_player_a != enemy)
310    
311    def can_lay_turd_at_loc(self, x:int, y:int, enemy:bool = False) -> bool:
312        """
313        Checks if the player or enemy can lay a turd at a specific location.
314
315        Parameters:
316            x (int): The x-coordinate of the location.
317            y (int): The y-coordinate of the location.
318            enemy (bool, optional): If True, checks for enemy; if False, checks for player.
319
320        Returns:
321            (bool): True if a turd can be laid at that location, False otherwise.
322        """
323        return self.game_board.can_lay_turd_at_loc(x, y, self.is_player_a != enemy)
324    
325    def set_trapdoor(self, x:int, y:int):
326        """
327        Sets a trapdoor at the specified location.
328
329        Parameters:
330            x (int): The x-coordinate for the trapdoor.
331            y (int): The y-coordinate for the trapdoor.
332        """
333        return self.game_board.set_trapdoor(x, y)
334    
335    
336    def is_my_turn(self, enemy:bool=False):
337        """
338        Checks if it is currently the player's or enemy's turn on the board.
339
340        Parameters:
341            enemy (bool, optional): If True, checks if it's enemy's turn; if False, checks if it's player's turn.
342
343        Returns:
344            (bool): True if it is the specified player's turn, False otherwise.
345        """
346        return self.game_board.a_to_play == (enemy != self.is_player_a)
347    
348    def get_winner(self) -> Result:
349        """
350        Returns the winner and reason for winning.
351
352        Returns:
353            (Result): A tuple containing the result and the reason for the win.
354        """
355        return self.game_board.get_winner()
356    
357    def get_time_left(self, enemy:bool=False) -> float:
358        """
359        Returns the time remaining for the player or enemy from the beginning of the turn.
360
361        Parameters:
362            enemy (bool, optional): If True, returns enemy's time; if False, returns player's time.
363
364        Returns:
365            (float): Time remaining in seconds.
366        """
367        return self.game_board.a_time if enemy!= self.is_player_a else self.game_board.b_time
368    
369    ######################################################
370    # MOVE FUNCTIONS
371    def apply_move(self, dir:Direction | int, move_type:MoveType | int, 
372                   enemy:bool = False, check_ok:bool = True, 
373                   reverse_perspective:bool =False) -> bool:
374        """
375        Applies a move to the board for the player or enemy.
376
377        Parameters:
378            dir (Direction or int): The direction of the move.
379            move_type (MoveType or int): The type of move (plain, egg, turd).
380            enemy (bool, optional): If True, applies move for enemy; if False, applies for player.
381            check_ok (bool, optional): If True, validates the move before applying; if False, skips validation.
382            reverse_perspective (bool, optional): If True, reverses perspective after applying the move.
383
384        Returns:
385            (bool): True if the move was successfully applied, False otherwise.
386        """
387
388        ok = self.game_board.apply_move(dir, move_type, enemy!=self.is_player_a, check_ok)
389
390        if not ok:
391            return False
392        if reverse_perspective:
393            self.reverse_perspective()
394        return True
395    
396    def forecast_move(self, dir:Direction | int, move_type:MoveType | int, enemy:bool = False, 
397                      check_ok:bool = True, reverse_perspective:bool = False) -> "PlayerBoard":
398        """
399        Creates a copy of the board with a forecasted move applied.
400
401        Parameters:
402            dir (Direction or int): The direction of the move.
403            move_type (MoveType or int): The type of move (plain, egg, turd).
404            enemy (bool, optional): If True, forecasts move for enemy; if False, forecasts for player.
405            check_ok (bool, optional): If True, validates the move before applying; if False, skips validation.
406            reverse_perspective (bool, optional): If True, reverses perspective after applying the move.
407
408        Returns:
409            (PlayerBoard): A new PlayerBoard object with the move applied, or None if the move is invalid.
410        """
411        player_board = self.get_copy()
412
413        ok = player_board.apply_move(self, dir, move_type, enemy, 
414                                     check_ok, reverse_perspective)
415        if not ok:
416            return None
417        
418        return player_board
419    
420    def get_valid_moves(self, enemy:bool=False) -> List[Tuple[Direction, MoveType]]:
421        """
422        Returns a list of all valid moves for the player or enemy.
423
424        Parameters:
425            enemy (bool, optional): If True, returns valid moves for enemy; if False, returns for player.
426
427        Returns:
428            (List[Tuple[Direction, MoveType]]): List of tuples containing valid direction and move type combinations.
429        """
430        valid_moves = []
431        for dir in Direction:
432            for move_type in MoveType:
433                if(self.game_board.is_valid_move(dir, move_type, self.is_player_a != enemy)):
434                    valid_moves.append((dir, move_type))
435
436        return valid_moves
437    
438    #####################
439    # CHICKEN FUNCTIONS #
440
441    def get_spawn(self, enemy:bool=False) -> Tuple:
442        """
443        Returns the spawn location of the player's or enemy's chicken.
444
445        Parameters:
446            enemy (bool, optional): If True, returns enemy's spawn; if False, returns player's spawn.
447
448        Returns:
449            (Tuple): The (x, y) coordinates of the spawn location.
450        """
451        if(enemy):
452            return self.chicken_enemy.get_spawn()
453        return self.chicken_player.get_spawn()
454    
455    def get_location(self, enemy:bool=False) -> Tuple:
456        """
457        Returns the current location of the player's or enemy's chicken.
458
459        Parameters:
460            enemy (bool, optional): If True, returns enemy's location; if False, returns player's location.
461
462        Returns:
463            (Tuple): The (x, y) coordinates of the current location.
464        """
465        if(enemy):
466            return self.chicken_enemy.get_location()
467        return self.chicken_player.get_location()
468    
469    def get_num_eggs_laid(self, enemy:bool = False) -> int:
470        """
471        Returns the number of eggs laid by the player or enemy.
472
473        Parameters:
474            enemy (bool, optional): If True, returns enemy's egg count; if False, returns player's egg count.
475
476        Returns:
477            (int): Number of eggs laid.
478        """
479        if(enemy):
480            return self.chicken_enemy.get_eggs_laid()
481        return self.chicken_player.get_eggs_laid()
482    
483    def get_next_loc(self, dir:Direction, enemy:bool = False) -> Tuple:
484        """
485        Returns the next location if the chicken moves in the specified direction.
486
487        Parameters:
488            dir (Direction): The direction to move.
489            enemy (bool, optional): If True, calculates for enemy; if False, calculates for player.
490
491        Returns:
492            (Tuple): The (x, y) coordinates of the next location.
493        """
494        if(enemy):
495            return self.chicken_enemy.get_next_loc(dir)
496        return self.chicken_player.get_next_loc(dir)
497    
498    def get_num_turds_placed(self, enemy:bool = False) -> int:
499        """
500        Returns the next location if the chicken moves in the specified direction.
501
502        Parameters:
503            dir (Direction): The direction to move.
504            enemy (bool, optional): If True, calculates for enemy; if False, calculates for player.
505
506        Returns:
507            (Tuple): The (x, y) coordinates of the next location.
508        """
509        if(enemy):
510            return self.chicken_enemy.get_turds_placed()
511        return self.chicken_player.get_turds_placed()
512    
513    def get_num_turds_left(self, enemy:bool = False) -> int:
514        """
515        Returns the number of turds placed by the player or enemy.
516
517        Parameters:
518            enemy (bool, optional): If True, returns enemy's turd count; if False, returns player's turd count.
519
520        Returns:
521            (int): Number of turds placed.
522        """
523        if(enemy):
524            return self.chicken_enemy.get_turds_left()
525        return self.chicken_player.get_turds_left()
526    
527    def has_turds_left(self, enemy:bool = False) -> bool:
528        """
529        Returns the number of turds remaining for the player or enemy.
530
531        Parameters:
532            enemy (bool, optional): If True, returns enemy's remaining turds; if False, returns player's remaining turds.
533
534        Returns:
535            (int): Number of turds remaining.
536        """
537       
538        if(enemy):
539            return self.chicken_enemy.has_turds_left()
540        return self.chicken_player.has_turds_left()
541
542    
543    #########################################
544    ## PLAYER BOARD UTILITY FUNCTIONS
545    def reverse_perspective(self):
546        """
547        Reverses the perspective from player to enemy or vice versa.
548        This swaps all player and enemy references internally.
549        """
550        self.is_player_a = not self.is_player_a
551
552        self.chicken_player, self.chicken_enemy = self.chicken_enemy, self.chicken_player
553
554        self.player_cells_blocked, self.enemy_cells_blocked = self.enemy_cells_blocked, self.player_cells_blocked
555        self.player_egg_list, self.enemy_egg_list = self.enemy_egg_list, self.player_egg_list
556
557        self.player_turd_list, self.enemy_turd_list = self.enemy_turd_list, self.player_turd_list
558
559    def get_copy(self):
560        """
561        Creates a deep copy of the current PlayerBoard.
562
563        Returns:
564            (PlayerBoard): A new PlayerBoard object with the same state as the current one.
565        """
566        return PlayerBoard(self.is_player_a, self.game_board.get_copy())
567
568
569
class PlayerBoard: 
  9class PlayerBoard:
 10    """
 11    A wrapper around the Board class to be able to call board and
 12    chicken functions from the player's perspective. 
 13    
 14    There are two ways to call functions in your opponent's perspective. 
 15    1. You may call functions with the "enemy" parameter as True.  
 16    2. You may instead reverse the perspective of the board
 17    through apply_move, forecast, or reverse_perspective. This will allow you to
 18    call functions from your opponents perspective. 
 19
 20    The playerboard you are passed will have the trapdoors unset, meaning you
 21    will have to keep track of the trapdoors yourself and set them at the beginning
 22    of each turn.  Trapdoor data is held
 23    by the game runner, so you will have to find and set the trapdoors yourself via set_trapdoor.
 24    Before then, any functions trying to get trapdoor data will not return anything valuable.
 25
 26    Any coordinates should be given to the player_board functions in the form of x, y.
 27    Game objects are displayed, indexed, and stored on the 
 28    board arrays as arr[y, x] for geometrical accuracy. Any functions that return
 29    mask arrays of the board that should be indexed by [y, x].
 30
 31    Check_validity/check_ok is on by default for most functions, but slows
 32    down execution. If a player is confident their actions are valid,
 33    they can directly apply turns and moves with check_validity as false.
 34
 35    Be wary that invalid actions/turns/function calls could lead to functions throwing
 36    errors, so make sure to handle them with a try/except in case so that
 37    your program doesn't crash. If an apply function throws an error,
 38    it is not guarenteed that the board state will be valid or that the state
 39    will be the same as when the function started.
 40    """
 41    def __init__(self, is_player_a:bool, game_board: Board):
 42        """
 43        Parameters:  
 44            is_player_a (bool): If True, the player is player A; if False, the player is player B.
 45            game_board (Board): The game board object that holds the state of the current match.
 46        """
 47        
 48        self.game_board = game_board
 49        self.is_player_a = is_player_a
 50
 51        self.chicken_player = game_board.chicken_a if is_player_a else game_board.chicken_b
 52        self.chicken_enemy = game_board.chicken_b if is_player_a else game_board.chicken_a
 53
 54        self.player_cells_blocked = game_board.cells_blocked_a if is_player_a else game_board.cells_blocked_b
 55        self.enemy_cells_blocked = game_board.cells_blocked_b if is_player_a else game_board.cells_blocked_a
 56
 57        self.player_egg_list = game_board.egg_list_a if is_player_a else game_board.egg_list_b
 58        self.enemy_egg_list = game_board.egg_list_b if is_player_a else game_board.egg_list_a
 59
 60        self.player_turd_list = game_board.turd_list_a if is_player_a else game_board.egg_list_b
 61        self.enemy_turd_list = game_board.turd_list_b if is_player_a else game_board.turd_list_a
 62
 63    ######################################################
 64    # BOARD STATE READING FUNCTIONS
 65    def get_dim_board(self) -> int:
 66        """
 67        Returns one dimension of the board.
 68
 69        Returns:  
 70            (int): Dimension of the board.
 71        """
 72        return self.game_board.game_map.MAP_SIZE
 73    
 74    def get_turn_count(self) -> int:
 75        """
 76        Returns the total number of turns that have been played.
 77
 78        Returns:
 79            (int): Number of turns played
 80        """
 81        return self.game_board.turn_count
 82

 84    def is_game_over(self) -> bool:
 85        """
 86        Checks if the game is over by determining if a winner
 87        has been set. Win conditions are checked by the game
 88        at the end of every turn.
 89
 90        Returns:  
 91            bool: True if the game is over, False otherwise.
 92        """
 93        return self.game_board.is_game_over()
 94    
 95    def get_egg_list(self, enemy:bool = False) -> List[Tuple[int, int]]:
 96        """
 97        Returns a copy of the list of laid eggs positions 
 98        for the player or enemy.
 99
100        Parameters:
101            enemy (bool, optional): If True, returns enemy's egg list; if False, returns player's egg list.
102
103        Returns:
104            (List[Tuple[int, int]]): A copy of the egg position list.
105        """
106        if enemy:
107            return self.enemy_egg_list[:]
108        return self.player_egg_list[:]
109    
110    def get_turd_list(self, enemy:bool = False) -> List[Tuple[int, int]]:
111        """
112        Returns a copy of the list of placed turd positions 
113        for the player or enemy.
114
115        Parameters:
116            enemy (bool, optional): If True, returns enemy's turd list; if False, returns player's turd list.
117
118        Returns:
119            (List[Tuple[int, int]]): A copy of the turd position list.
120        """
121        if(enemy):
122            return self.enemy_turd_list[:]
123        return self.player_turd_list[:]
124
125    def get_cells_blocked(self, enemy:bool = False) -> np.ndarray:
126        """
127        Returns a copy of the blocked cells array for the player or enemy.
128        
129        Parameters:
130            enemy (bool, optional): If True, returns enemy's blocked cells; if False, returns player's blocked cells.
131
132        Returns:
133            (np.ndarray): A 2D array where blocked cells have values > 0, indexed by [y, x].
134        """
135        if(enemy):
136            return np.array(self.enemy_cells_blocked)
137        return np.array(self.player_cells_blocked)
138    
139    def get_cells_eggsturds(self) -> np.ndarray:
140        """
141        Returns a mask of the board with the cells containing
142        eggs and turds marked with enums.
143
144        Returns:
145            (np.ndarray): A 2D array indicating egg and turd locations, indexed by [y, x].
146        """
147        return np.array(self.game_board.cells_eggsturds)
148    
149    def cell_has_eggsturds(self, x: int, y: int) -> Cell:
150        """
151        Checks if a specific cell contains an egg or turd.
152
153        Parameters:
154            x (int): The x-coordinate of the cell.
155            y (int): The y-coordinate of the cell.
156
157        Returns:
158            (Cell): The Cell enum value indicating what is at that location.
159        """
160        return Cell(self.game_board.cells_eggsturds[y][x])
161    
162    def is_cell_blocked(self, x, y, enemy:bool = False) -> bool:
163        """
164        Checks if a specific cell is blocked for the player or enemy.
165
166        Parameters:
167            x (int): The x-coordinate of the cell.
168            y (int): The y-coordinate of the cell.
169            enemy (bool, optional): If True, checks enemy's blocked cells; if False, checks player's blocked cells.
170
171        Returns:
172            (bool): True if the cell is blocked, False otherwise.
173        """
174        if(enemy):
175            return self.enemy_cells_blocked[y,x] > 0
176        return self.player_cells_blocked[y,x] > 0
177    
178    def get_trapdoors(self) -> List[Tuple[int, int]]:
179        """

181
182        Returns:

184        """
185        return self.game_board.trapdoors[:]

193            y (int): The y-coordinate of the cell.
194
195        Returns:
196            (bool): True if there is a trapdoor at that location, False otherwise.
197        """
198        return self.game_board.cells_trapdoors[y,x] > 0

260    def is_valid_move(self, dir:Direction | int, move_type:MoveType | int, enemy:bool = False) -> bool:

267            enemy (bool, optional): If True, checks validity for enemy; if False, checks for player.

337    def is_my_turn(self, enemy:bool=False):
338        """
339        Checks if it is currently the player's or enemy's turn on the board.
340
341        Parameters:
342            enemy (bool, optional): If True, checks if it's enemy's turn; if False, checks if it's player's turn.
343
344        Returns:
345            (bool): True if it is the specified player's turn, False otherwise.
346        """
347        return self.game_board.a_to_play == (enemy != self.is_player_a)

350        """

358    def get_time_left(self, enemy:bool=False) -> float:
359        """
360        Returns the time remaining for the player or enemy from the beginning of the turn.
361
362        Parameters:
363            enemy (bool, optional): If True, returns enemy's time; if False, returns player's time.
364
365        Returns:
366            (float): Time remaining in seconds.
367        """
368        return self.game_board.a_time if enemy!= self.is_player_a else self.game_board.b_time
369    
370    ######################################################
371    # MOVE FUNCTIONS
372    def apply_move(self, dir:Direction | int, move_type:MoveType | int, 
373                   enemy:bool = False, check_ok:bool = True, 
374                   reverse_perspective:bool =False) -> bool:
375        """
376        Applies a move to the board for the player or enemy.
377
378        Parameters:
379            dir (Direction or int): The direction of the move.
380            move_type (MoveType or int): The type of move (plain, egg, turd).
381            enemy (bool, optional): If True, applies move for enemy; if False, applies for player.
382            check_ok (bool, optional): If True, validates the move before applying; if False, skips validation.
383            reverse_perspective (bool, optional): If True, reverses perspective after applying the move.
384
385        Returns:
386            (bool): True if the move was successfully applied, False otherwise.
387        """
388
389        ok = self.game_board.apply_move(dir, move_type, enemy!=self.is_player_a, check_ok)
390
391        if not ok:
392            return False
393        if reverse_perspective:
394            self.reverse_perspective()
395        return True
396    
397    def forecast_move(self, dir:Direction | int, move_type:MoveType | int, enemy:bool = False, 
398                      check_ok:bool = True, reverse_perspective:bool = False) -> "PlayerBoard":
399        """
400        Creates a copy of the board with a forecasted move applied.
401
402        Parameters:
403            dir (Direction or int): The direction of the move.
404            move_type (MoveType or int): The type of move (plain, egg, turd).
405            enemy (bool, optional): If True, forecasts move for enemy; if False, forecasts for player.
406            check_ok (bool, optional): If True, validates the move before applying; if False, skips validation.
407            reverse_perspective (bool, optional): If True, reverses perspective after applying the move.
408
409        Returns:
410            (PlayerBoard): A new PlayerBoard object with the move applied, or None if the move is invalid.
411        """
412        player_board = self.get_copy()
413
414        ok = player_board.apply_move(self, dir, move_type, enemy, 
415                                     check_ok, reverse_perspective)
416        if not ok:
417            return None
418        
419        return player_board
420    
421    def get_valid_moves(self, enemy:bool=False) -> List[Tuple[Direction, MoveType]]:
422        """
423        Returns a list of all valid moves for the player or enemy.
424
425        Parameters:
426            enemy (bool, optional): If True, returns valid moves for enemy; if False, returns for player.
427
428        Returns:
429            (List[Tuple[Direction, MoveType]]): List of tuples containing valid direction and move type combinations.
430        """
431        valid_moves = []
432        for dir in Direction:
433            for move_type in MoveType:
434                if(self.game_board.is_valid_move(dir, move_type, self.is_player_a != enemy)):
435                    valid_moves.append((dir, move_type))
436
437        return valid_moves
438

440    # CHICKEN FUNCTIONS #

542
543    
544    #########################################
545    ## PLAYER BOARD UTILITY FUNCTIONS
546    def reverse_perspective(self):
547        """
548        Reverses the perspective from player to enemy or vice versa.
549        This swaps all player and enemy references internally.
550        """
551        self.is_player_a = not self.is_player_a
552
553        self.chicken_player, self.chicken_enemy = self.chicken_enemy, self.chicken_player
554
555        self.player_cells_blocked, self.enemy_cells_blocked = self.enemy_cells_blocked, self.player_cells_blocked
556        self.player_egg_list, self.enemy_egg_list = self.enemy_egg_list, self.player_egg_list
557
558        self.player_turd_list, self.enemy_turd_list = self.enemy_turd_list, self.player_turd_list
559
560    def get_copy(self):
561        """
562        Creates a deep copy of the current PlayerBoard.
563
564        Returns:
565            (PlayerBoard): A new PlayerBoard object with the same state as the current one.
566        """
567        return PlayerBoard(self.is_player_a, self.game_board.get_copy())

A wrapper around the Board class to be able to call board and chicken functions from the player's perspective.

There are two ways to call functions in your opponent's perspective.

  1. You may call functions with the "enemy" parameter as True.
  2. You may instead reverse the perspective of the board through apply_move, forecast, or reverse_perspective. This will allow you to call functions from your opponents perspective.

The playerboard you are passed will have the trapdoors unset, meaning you will have to keep track of the trapdoors yourself and set them at the beginning of each turn. Trapdoor data is held by the game runner, so you will have to find and set the trapdoors yourself via set_trapdoor. Before then, any functions trying to get trapdoor data will not return anything valuable.

Any coordinates should be given to the player_board functions in the form of x, y. Game objects are displayed, indexed, and stored on the board arrays as arr[y, x] for geometrical accuracy. Any functions that return mask arrays of the board that should be indexed by [y, x].

Check_validity/check_ok is on by default for most functions, but slows down execution. If a player is confident their actions are valid, they can directly apply turns and moves with check_validity as false.

Be wary that invalid actions/turns/function calls could lead to functions throwing errors, so make sure to handle them with a try/except in case so that your program doesn't crash. If an apply function throws an error, it is not guarenteed that the board state will be valid or that the state will be the same as when the function started.

PlayerBoard(is_player_a: bool, game_board: game.board.Board) 
41    def __init__(self, is_player_a:bool, game_board: Board):
42        """
43        Parameters:  
44            is_player_a (bool): If True, the player is player A; if False, the player is player B.
45            game_board (Board): The game board object that holds the state of the current match.
46        """
47        
48        self.game_board = game_board
49        self.is_player_a = is_player_a
50
51        self.chicken_player = game_board.chicken_a if is_player_a else game_board.chicken_b
52        self.chicken_enemy = game_board.chicken_b if is_player_a else game_board.chicken_a
53
54        self.player_cells_blocked = game_board.cells_blocked_a if is_player_a else game_board.cells_blocked_b
55        self.enemy_cells_blocked = game_board.cells_blocked_b if is_player_a else game_board.cells_blocked_a
56
57        self.player_egg_list = game_board.egg_list_a if is_player_a else game_board.egg_list_b
58        self.enemy_egg_list = game_board.egg_list_b if is_player_a else game_board.egg_list_a
59
60        self.player_turd_list = game_board.turd_list_a if is_player_a else game_board.egg_list_b
61        self.enemy_turd_list = game_board.turd_list_b if is_player_a else game_board.turd_list_a

118        Returns:

120        """
121        if(enemy):
122            return self.enemy_turd_list[:]
123        return self.player_turd_list[:]

def apply_move( self, dir: game.enums.Direction | int, move_type: game.enums.MoveType | int, enemy: bool = False, check_ok: bool = True, reverse_perspective: bool = False) -> bool: 
372    def apply_move(self, dir:Direction | int, move_type:MoveType | int, 
373                   enemy:bool = False, check_ok:bool = True, 
374                   reverse_perspective:bool =False) -> bool:
375        """
376        Applies a move to the board for the player or enemy.
377
378        Parameters:
379            dir (Direction or int): The direction of the move.
380            move_type (MoveType or int): The type of move (plain, egg, turd).
381            enemy (bool, optional): If True, applies move for enemy; if False, applies for player.
382            check_ok (bool, optional): If True, validates the move before applying; if False, skips validation.
383            reverse_perspective (bool, optional): If True, reverses perspective after applying the move.
384
385        Returns:
386            (bool): True if the move was successfully applied, False otherwise.
387        """
388
389        ok = self.game_board.apply_move(dir, move_type, enemy!=self.is_player_a, check_ok)
390
391        if not ok:
392            return False
393        if reverse_perspective:
394            self.reverse_perspective()
395        return True

Applies a move to the board for the player or enemy.

Parameters: dir (Direction or int): The direction of the move. move_type (MoveType or int): The type of move (plain, egg, turd). enemy (bool, optional): If True, applies move for enemy; if False, applies for player. check_ok (bool, optional): If True, validates the move before applying; if False, skips validation. reverse_perspective (bool, optional): If True, reverses perspective after applying the move.

Returns: (bool): True if the move was successfully applied, False otherwise.

def forecast_move( self, dir: game.enums.Direction | int, move_type: game.enums.MoveType | int, enemy: bool = False, check_ok: bool = True, reverse_perspective: bool = False) -> PlayerBoard: 
397    def forecast_move(self, dir:Direction | int, move_type:MoveType | int, enemy:bool = False, 
398                      check_ok:bool = True, reverse_perspective:bool = False) -> "PlayerBoard":
399        """
400        Creates a copy of the board with a forecasted move applied.
401
402        Parameters:
403            dir (Direction or int): The direction of the move.
404            move_type (MoveType or int): The type of move (plain, egg, turd).
405            enemy (bool, optional): If True, forecasts move for enemy; if False, forecasts for player.
406            check_ok (bool, optional): If True, validates the move before applying; if False, skips validation.
407            reverse_perspective (bool, optional): If True, reverses perspective after applying the move.
408
409        Returns:
410            (PlayerBoard): A new PlayerBoard object with the move applied, or None if the move is invalid.
411        """
412        player_board = self.get_copy()
413
414        ok = player_board.apply_move(self, dir, move_type, enemy, 
415                                     check_ok, reverse_perspective)
416        if not ok:
417            return None
418        
419        return player_board

Creates a copy of the board with a forecasted move applied.

Parameters: dir (Direction or int): The direction of the move. move_type (MoveType or int): The type of move (plain, egg, turd). enemy (bool, optional): If True, forecasts move for enemy; if False, forecasts for player. check_ok (bool, optional): If True, validates the move before applying; if False, skips validation. reverse_perspective (bool, optional): If True, reverses perspective after applying the move.

Returns: (PlayerBoard): A new PlayerBoard object with the move applied, or None if the move is invalid.

def get_valid_moves( self, enemy: bool = False) -> List[Tuple[game.enums.Direction, game.enums.MoveType]]: 
421    def get_valid_moves(self, enemy:bool=False) -> List[Tuple[Direction, MoveType]]:
422        """
423        Returns a list of all valid moves for the player or enemy.
424
425        Parameters:
426            enemy (bool, optional): If True, returns valid moves for enemy; if False, returns for player.
427
428        Returns:
429            (List[Tuple[Direction, MoveType]]): List of tuples containing valid direction and move type combinations.
430        """
431        valid_moves = []
432        for dir in Direction:
433            for move_type in MoveType:
434                if(self.game_board.is_valid_move(dir, move_type, self.is_player_a != enemy)):
435                    valid_moves.append((dir, move_type))
436
437        return valid_moves

Returns a list of all valid moves for the player or enemy.

Parameters: enemy (bool, optional): If True, returns valid moves for enemy; if False, returns for player.

Returns: (List[Tuple[Direction, MoveType]]): List of tuples containing valid direction and move type combinations.

def reverse_perspective(self): 
546    def reverse_perspective(self):
547        """
548        Reverses the perspective from player to enemy or vice versa.
549        This swaps all player and enemy references internally.
550        """
551        self.is_player_a = not self.is_player_a
552
553        self.chicken_player, self.chicken_enemy = self.chicken_enemy, self.chicken_player
554
555        self.player_cells_blocked, self.enemy_cells_blocked = self.enemy_cells_blocked, self.player_cells_blocked
556        self.player_egg_list, self.enemy_egg_list = self.enemy_egg_list, self.player_egg_list
557
558        self.player_turd_list, self.enemy_turd_list = self.enemy_turd_list, self.player_turd_list

Reverses the perspective from player to enemy or vice versa. This swaps all player and enemy references internally.

def get_copy(self): 
560    def get_copy(self):
561        """
562        Creates a deep copy of the current PlayerBoard.
563
564        Returns:
565            (PlayerBoard): A new PlayerBoard object with the same state as the current one.
566        """
567        return PlayerBoard(self.is_player_a, self.game_board.get_copy())

Creates a deep copy of the current PlayerBoard.

Returns: (PlayerBoard): A new PlayerBoard object with the same state as the current one.
